definition: meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
erhua variant of 小伙[xiao3 huo3]

sentences.english: I hadn't seen Gordy in years, but the boy always liked to showboat .
sentences.chinese: 我已经很多年没有见到高迪了，但那小伙总喜欢炫耀。

sentences.english: See small trick, the Indus to golden phoenix.
sentences.chinese: 且看小伙有绝招，梧桐来了金凤凰。

sentences.english: That youngster works with a will.
sentences.chinese: 这小伙子干活有股傻劲儿。

sentences.english: Such boys as we know are drillers.
sentences.chinese: 我们认识的这样一些小伙子都是司钻。

sentences.english: The youth imagined he was out of sorts, and set to whistling softly.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子以为他情绪不好，就轻轻吹起了口哨。

sentences.english: Why, hello there, little fella. Didn't think I'd see you again.
sentences.chinese: 小伙计你怎么在这里？没想到还能再看到你。

sentences.english: This young man's name is Lu Yan. He is Shen Hongmei's boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 这位小伙子叫吕岩，他是沈红梅的男朋友。

sentences.english: You will be a boy if you some fashionable clothes.
sentences.chinese: 如果你穿些新潮的衣服打扮一下，你会是个帅小伙。

sentences.english: Did you ever see a laddie go this way and that?
sentences.chinese: 你有见过一个到处走的小伙子吗？

sentences.english: The beautiful lady smiles and waves her hand to the handsome guy.
sentences.chinese: 这位漂亮的女士笑着朝这个英俊的小伙子招了招手。

sentences.english: The boys broke the sticks easily in their hands.
sentences.chinese: 四个小伙子用手轻轻一撅，树枝就断了。

sentences.english: She really turns on the charm when that new boy is around.
sentences.chinese: 当那个新来的小伙子在旁边时，他真是尽施魅力。

sentences.english: This young chap is very tall.
"Are you going to dance?" asked the man pleasantly.
sentences.chinese: “你打算跳舞吗？”小伙子文雅地问道。

sentences.english: Serious surfers are much stronger and thinner than beach boys.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪运动员要比沙滩小伙儿强壮得多，瘦得多。

sentences.english: Senor Dahlmann, don't pay any attention to those lads; they're half high.
sentences.chinese: 达尔曼先生，那些小伙子醉了，别理他们。

definition: erhua variant of 小伙[xiao3 huo3]
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
